pull.title: travis: Remove s390x build
pull.body:
This has been discussed in the last meeting.

Refer to the commit body for more details.

verification.payload:
tree 35848bdf3afe4e642058939c926aa5502f1db581
parent f33e3325417988711476fd4703ac013d13a5de46
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1604572528 +0100
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1604574018 +0100

travis: Remove s390x build

The build didn't find too many issues, and they are generally only
endianness related, so easy to fix if they do make it into the main
developement branch.

With travis migrating its service, it fails too often intermittently. It
might be more appropriate to run it manually once before every release.

events.message:

The build didn't find too many issues, and they are generally only

verification.payload:
tree 30f5d4e35894a204bbf07f13da3b2d4695c1ebf8
parent fac05178366a1c9100b1d19d66fb669d7266f306
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1604571541 +0100
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1604577291 +0100

ci: Set LC_ALL=C to allow running the s390x tests in qemu

Without the fix, the tests immediately abort:

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::runtime_error'
  what():  locale::facet::_S_create_c_locale name not valid
./qt/test/test_bitcoin-qt: line 2: 116150 Aborted

events.message:
ci: Set LC_ALL=C to allow running the s390x tests in qemu

Without the fix, the tests immediately abort:

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::runtime_error'
  what():  locale::facet::_S_create_c_locale name not valid
./qt/test/test_bitcoin-qt: line 2: 116150 Aborted

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #19179 ([WIP RFC DONOTMERGE] ci: Run ci configs on cirrus by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Do I understand correctly that the last commit fixes _manual_ s390x builds?
It fixes *qemu* builds. Manual and automatic
could you explain why we should remove this? @MarcoFalke

* Running it on travis has been unreliable (search for s390x issues in this repo)
* travis org is shutting down and there is no s390x on travis com
* the test is more meaningful if run either locally in qemu or on any other arch that has different endianness

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -72,13 +72,6 @@ jobs:
         FILE_ENV="./ci/test/00_setup_env_arm.sh"
         QEMU_USER_CMD=""
 
-    - stage: test
-      name: 'S390x  [GOAL: install]  [buster]  [unit tests, functional tests]'
-      arch: s390x  # Can disable QEMU_USER_CMD and run the tests natively without qemu
-      env: >-
-        FILE_ENV="./ci/test/00_setup_env_s390x.sh"

@@ -72,13 +72,6 @@ jobs:
         FILE_ENV="./ci/test/00_setup_env_arm.sh"
         QEMU_USER_CMD=""
 
-    - stage: test
-      name: 'S390x  [GOAL: install]  [buster]  [unit tests, functional tests]'
-      arch: s390x  # Can disable QEMU_USER_CMD and run the tests natively without qemu
-      env: >-
-        FILE_ENV="./ci/test/00_setup_env_s390x.sh"
comments.body: I'd like to keep it so that it can be executed easier, if needed
